result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas R Raether was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to Count 1 in Chippewa County Case No. 14CF135

superMiscConds.notes:
To be determined for any medical or counseling required for victims.
Pursuant to an Order (DOC-31) dated July 8, 2015, $6,871 represents Restitution plus a surcharge of $687.10.  Restitution may be amended for any future medical or counseling bills related to this incident.
Pursuant to 2nd Amended Restitution Order (DOC-31) dated 02/11/2016, $9,612.46 represents restitution plus $961.25 restitution surcharge.  Restitution may be amended for any future medical or counseling bills related to this incident.
Pursuant to an Order (DOC-31) dated August 10, 2015, $7,198.60 represents Restitution plus a surcharge of $719.86.  Restitution may be amended for any future medical or counseling bills related to this incident.
Pursuant to 3rd Amended Restitution Order (DOC-31) dated 04/08/2016, $5,670.27 represents restitution plus $567.03 restitution surcharge.  04/06/2016 - Per conversation with victim, they are not out any pocket expense/bp

Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  $250 represents the DNA Surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

No contact with:  any female under the age of 18 without prior written permission from Probation Agent.  No cell phone or any other electronic device that can take pictures without written prior permission from Probation Agent.  Not to possess computer, software or hardware, modem or any device that is internet compatible without prior written permission from Probation Agent.  No contact with any victims in all cases including read-in and uncharged.  Not to work or volunteer for work with children under the age of 16.  Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.    Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Submit a DNA sample.  Comply with mandatory sex offender registration and any mandatory GPS or residence restrictions.
